key_points: Rep. Lauren Boebert wore a controversial t-shirt referencing Alec Baldwin in relation to the 'Rust' film set shooting.
The t-shirt's message, 'GUNS DON'T KILL PEOPLE ALEC BALDWIN DOES,' is seen as disrespectful towards the victim Halyna Hutchins and her family.
'Rust' actor Marty Lindsey expressed disgust and called Boebert's action 'unconscionable.'
Lindsey highlighted that Boebert's behavior shows disregard for Hutchins' family and the tragedy.
The incident referred to occurred when Alec Baldwin accidentally killed cinematographer Halyna Hutchins on the 'Rust' film set.
Boebert's office has not commented on the matter.
A similar t-shirt is available in an online store run by Donald Trump, Jr.
Boebert has a history of using clothing to make political statements.
This is not the first time Boebert has mocked Baldwin since the incident; she made a tweet referencing him the day after Hutchins' death.
Lindsey is disappointed in Boebert's connection to Colorado, as both he and another impacted actor are from the state.
